title: Junior's Academy Kick-off
description:
You will find out what Junior's Academy is in a nutshell and in detail, how to get started with Junior's Academy; what your everyday work and priorities will look like during juniorship period, 
how to work with your mentor, and next steps that you will need to take.

published_attributes.title: Junior's Academy in a nutshell
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Click play in the embedded window below to get a bird's eye view on Junior's Academy.

Once you finish, click the "Continue" button below, at the bottom of the Bridge app.

SCRIPT:

Junior's Academy is a comprehensive, development path for Juniors in Delivery Teams. Itâ€™s been designed by Netguru Learning and Development Team in cooperation with representatives from all technology stacks.

The heart of the program is a checklist that contains a variety of microlearning items that will be easy for you to go through gradually and tick off as done. Some of them will require some self-study - reading an article or going through an elearning course. Otherâ€™s will be in the form of practical assignments. Most importantly, you will have time and space to discuss your learnings with a dedicated mentor - a more experienced person from your stack.

The program is pretty flexible but shouldnâ€™t take you more than 6 months to complete. We've grouped the learning items into 5 chunks and assigned them a period of time and a theme having in mind the total period of 6 months. You may however finish it sooner, depending on your previous experience and skills.

Have a great and fruitful learning experience.

published_attributes.title: Everyday work and priorities
published_attributes.serialized_body:
There are a couple of scenarios and your priorities will depend on that.

SCENARIO 1 - you join Netguru and you are immediately assigned to a commercial project.

The project is always a top priority and this is where you learn the most. Your project's Project Manager or Account Manager will let the client know that you have 8h weekly (95 minutes daily or it's equivalent cumulated in more than one day depending on your arrangement with the project team) to work on Junior's Academy. There may be times when you will be asked to focus entirely on the project. If it happens, talk to your Project Manager if and how you could make up for that time and use it for Junior's Academy in the future. 

SCENARIO 2 - you join Netguru and there is no commercial project for you yet but you're assigned to an internal project (e.g. Bob the bot)

The project is always a top priority but in this case project work and Junior's Academy are almost equally important. Make sure you have 8h weekly (95 minutes daily or it's equivalent cumulated in more than one day depending on your arrangement with the project team) to work on Junior's Academy.

SCENARIO 3 - you join Netguru and you are not yet assigned to a commercial project nor an internal project.

Use this time to the maximum to work on Junior's Academy - this, apart from onboarding to the company, will be your top priority. You will be assigned to a commercial or internal project rather sooner than later.

published_attributes.title: Use your mentor to the fullest!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You are in the driver's seat when it comes to the successful conclusion of your juniorship period and becoming a Regular.

However, there are lots of people at Netguru that wish you well and can help when such need arises.

USE YOUR MENTOR TO THE FULLEST:

  • get in touch as soon as you find out who your mentor is
  • schedule regular calls with your mentor to work on "mentor talking points" from Junior's Academy (confirm together the frequency and length of such calls)
  • don't be afraid to ask for help or say that you don't understand something - if your mentor can't help you or doesn't have the capacity, they can redirect you to someone else who can or does
  • reach out to your mentor on Slack between calls if need be - sometimes you don't need a call to remove a roadblock

published_attributes.title: Next steps
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Now is the time get the most of the project you already are or will be assigned to. Time to add to the skills and experience your project will provide you with through Junior's Academy.

You will be reminded in the checklist at the end of your juniorship to come back to this course and complete the final step.
